title: A shopkeeper sells two computers for Rs 24000 each. On first he gained 20% and on the other, he lost 20%. What is the overall gain or loss percentage? Is it 0? - Quora

response.answer_text: If he sells the first computer at a profit margin of 20% That basically means that the cost price was 20000. The second computer ,as stated, was sold at 24000 at a loss margin of 20% and that implies that the cost price was 30000 . From the above given statements we infer that the seller makes a profit of 4000 using the first computer and the a loss of 6000 with the second computer. And we therefore conclude that the seller makes an overall loss of 2000!! or, u can say a profit of -2000!

Sale price of first computer = Rs 24000 gain = 20% So cost of first computer = 100/120 x 24000 = Rs 20,000 Sale price of second computer = Rs 24000 Loss 20% So cost of second computer = 100/80 x 24000 = Rs 30,000 Total cost = Rs 50,000 Total sale value = Rs 48000 Loss = Rs 2000 Loss % = 2000/50000 x100= 4 % LOSS ANSWER
